00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 #define MAX_ARGCOUNT 100
00013 #define MAX_MESS_SIZE 2048
00014 
00015 typedef struct _oscroute{                                       // Data Structure for this object
00016         t_object                ob;                                                     // REQUIRED: Our object
00017         void                    *obex;                                          // REQUIRED: Object Extensions used by Jitter/Attribute stuff 
00018         void                    *outlets[MAX_ARGCOUNT];         // my outlet array
00019         void                    *outlet_overflow;                       // this outlet doubles as the dumpout outlet
00020         t_symbol                *arguments[MAX_ARGCOUNT];       // symbols to match
00021         long unsigned   arglen[MAX_ARGCOUNT];           // strlen of symbols to match
00022         short                   num_args;
00023         long                    attr_strip;                                     // ATTRIBUTE: 1 = strip leading slash off any messages
00024         void                    *proxy_inlet;                           // pointer to the second inlet (when present)
00025 } t_oscroute;
00026 
00027 // Prototypes for our methods:
00028 void *oscroute_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00029 void oscroute_free(t_oscroute *x);
00030 void oscroute_assist(t_oscroute *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00031 void oscroute_bang(t_oscroute *x);
00032 void oscroute_int(t_oscroute *x, long n);
00033 void oscroute_float(t_oscroute *x, double f);
00034 void oscroute_list(t_oscroute *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00035 void oscroute_symbol(t_oscroute *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00036 //void oscroute_list(t_oscroute *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);

00038 // Globals
00039 t_class         *oscroute_class;                                // Required: Global pointer for our class

00041 
00042 /************************************************************************************/
00043 // Main() Function
00044 
00045 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00046 {
00047         long attrflags = 0;
00048         t_class *c;
00049         t_object *attr;
00050         
00051         // Initialize Globals
00052         jamoma_init();
00053 
00054         // Define our class
00055         c = class_new("jcom.oscroute",(method)oscroute_new, (method)oscroute_free, (short)sizeof(t_oscroute), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00056         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_oscroute, obex));
00057 
00058         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)oscroute_bang,                       "bang",         0L,                     0L);    
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)oscroute_int,                        "int",          A_DEFLONG,      0L);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)oscroute_float,                      "float",        A_DEFFLOAT,     0L);
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)oscroute_list,                       "list",         A_GIMME,        0L);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)oscroute_symbol,                     "anything", A_GIMME,    0L);    
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)oscroute_assist,                     "assist",       A_CANT,         0L); 
00065     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout",      A_CANT,         0);  
00066     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT,             0);
00067 
00068         // ATTRIBUTE: strip
00069         attr = attr_offset_new("strip", _sym_long, attrflags,
00070                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_oscroute, attr_strip));
00071         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00072 
00073         // Finalize our class
00074         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00075         oscroute_class = c;
00076         return 0;
00077 }

00080 /************************************************************************************/
00081 // Object Life
00082 
00083 void *oscroute_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00084 {
00085         short i;
00086         t_oscroute      *x = (t_oscroute *)object_alloc(oscroute_class);
00087         
00088         if(x){
00089                 x->outlet_overflow = outlet_new(x, 0);          // overflow outlet
00090                 //object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)x->outlet_overflow);     // dumpout
00091                 x->num_args = argc;
00092                 
00093                 if(argc < 1){   // if no args are provided, we provide a way to set the arg using an inlet
00094                         x->num_args = 1;
00095                         x->arguments[0] = gensym("/nil");
00096                         x->arglen[0] = 4;
00097                         x->proxy_inlet = proxy_new(x, 1, 0L);
00098                         x->outlets[0] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00099                 }
00100                 else{
00101                         x->proxy_inlet = 0;
00102                         for(i=x->num_args-1; i >= 0; i--){                              
00103                                 x->outlets[i] = outlet_new(x, 0);               // Create Outlet
00104                                 switch(argv[i].a_type){
00105                                         case A_SYM:
00106                                                 //atom_setsym(&(x->arguments[i]), atom_getsym(argv+i));
00107                                                 x->arguments[i] = atom_getsym(argv+i);
00108                                                 x->arglen[i] = strlen(atom_getsym(argv+i)->s_name);
00109                                                 break;
00110                                         default:
00111                                                 error("jcom.oscroute - invalid arguments - all args must be symbols");
00112                                 }
00113                         }
00114                 }
00115                 //attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                     //handle attribute args 
00116         }
00117         return (x);                                                                             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00118 }
00119 
00120 void oscroute_free(t_oscroute *x)
00121 {
00122         if(x->proxy_inlet != 0)
00123                 freeobject((t_object *)(x->proxy_inlet));
00124 }

00128 /************************************************************************************/
00129 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00130 
00131 // Method for Assistance Messages
00132 void oscroute_assist(t_oscroute *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00133 {
00134         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00135                 strcpy(dst, "Input");
00136         else if(msg==2){                                // Outlets
00137                 if(arg < x->num_args)
00138                         strcpy(dst, x->arguments[arg]->s_name);
00139                 else
00140                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout / overflow from non-matching input");      
00141         }               
00142 }

00145 // BANG INPUT: STRAIGHT TO OVERFLOW
00146 void oscroute_bang(t_oscroute *x)
00147 {
00148         outlet_bang(x->outlet_overflow);
00149 }
00150 
00151 // INT INPUT: STRAIGHT TO OVERFLOW
00152 void oscroute_int(t_oscroute *x, long n)
00153 {
00154         outlet_int(x->outlet_overflow, n);
00155 }
00156 
00157 // FLOAT INPUT: STRAIGHT TO OVERFLOW
00158 void oscroute_float(t_oscroute *x, double f)
00159 {
00160         outlet_float(x->outlet_overflow, f);
00161 }
00162 
00163 // LIST INPUT: STRAIGHT TO OVERFLOW
00164 void oscroute_list(t_oscroute *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00165 {
00166         outlet_list(x->outlet_overflow, _sym_list, argc , argv);
00167 }
00168 
00169 void output_msg(t_oscroute *x, char *msg, int outlet, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00170 {
00171         t_symbol *output;
00172         if(msg == '\0') {
00173                 
00174                 if (argc == 0) {
00175                         outlet_bang(x->outlets[outlet]);
00176                 } else if (argc==1) {
00177                 
00178                         if (argv->a_type==A_LONG) 
00179                                 outlet_int(x->outlets[outlet],argv->a_w.w_long);                                
00180                         else if (argv->a_type==A_FLOAT) 
00181                                 outlet_float(x->outlets[outlet],argv->a_w.w_float);
00182                         else if (argv->a_type==A_SYM) 
00183                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[outlet],argv->a_w.w_sym,0,0);
00184                                 
00185                 } else {
00186                         if (argv->a_type==A_SYM) {
00187                                 output = argv->a_w.w_sym;
00188                                 argc--;
00189                                 argv++;
00190                         } else {
00191                                 output = _sym_list;
00192                         }
00193                                         
00194                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[outlet], output, argc, argv);
00195                 }                               
00196         } else 
00197                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[outlet], gensym(msg), argc, argv);
00198         
00199 }
00200 
00201 // SYMBOL INPUT
00202 void oscroute_symbol(t_oscroute *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00203 {
00204         short           i;
00205         t_symbol        *message;                               // our input message to match
00206         t_symbol        *output;
00207         char            input[MAX_MESS_SIZE];   // our input string
00208         long            inlet = proxy_getinlet((t_object *)x);
00209 
00210         // If the message comes in the second inlet, then set the string to match...
00211         if(inlet == 1){
00212                 x->arguments[0] = msg;
00213                 x->arglen[0] = strlen(msg->s_name);
00214                 return;
00215         }
00216         
00217         // Otherwise match the stored string(s) and output...
00218         strcpy(input, msg->s_name);
00219 
00220         // Make sure we are dealing with valid OSC input by looking for a leading slash
00221         
00222         if(input[0] != '/') {
00223                 outlet_anything(x->outlet_overflow, msg, argc , argv);
00224                 return;
00225         }
00226 
00227         message = gensym(input);
00228         
00229         char *wc, *c;
00230         bool overFlow = true;
00231         for (i=0; i < x->num_args; i++) {
00232                 // Look for exact matches first.
00233                 if (strncmp(msg->s_name, x->arguments[i]->s_name, x->arglen[i])==0) {
00234                         // If incoming message is longer than argument...
00235                         if (strlen(msg->s_name) > x->arglen[i]){
00236                                 // ...it is only a match if it continues with a slash
00237                                 if (input[x->arglen[i]] == '/') {
00238                                         output = gensym(msg->s_name + x->arglen[i]);
00239                                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[i], output, argc , argv);
00240                                         overFlow = false;
00241                                         break;
00242                                 }
00243                         }
00244                         // If the incoming message is no longer we know that we have a match
00245                         else {
00246                         
00247                                 // We then have to check what message to return.
00248                                 // The message received has no arguments:
00249                                 if (argc == 0) {
00250                                         outlet_bang(x->outlets[i]);
00251                                         overFlow = false;
00252                                         break;
00253                                 }
00254                                 // The message received has one argument only:
00255                                 else if (argc==1) {
00256                                         overFlow = false;
00257                                         // int argument
00258                                         if (argv->a_type==A_LONG) {
00259                                                 outlet_int(x->outlets[i],argv->a_w.w_long);
00260                                                 break;
00261                                         }                               
00262                                         // float argument
00263                                         else if (argv->a_type==A_FLOAT) {
00264                                                 outlet_float(x->outlets[i],argv->a_w.w_float);
00265                                                 break;
00266                                         }
00267                                         // something else
00268                                         else if (argv->a_type==A_SYM) {
00269                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[i],argv->a_w.w_sym,0,0);
00270                                                 break;
00271                                         }                               
00272                                 }               
00273                                 // There are two or more arguments: check if first is A_SYM     
00274                                 else {
00275                                         if (argv->a_type==A_SYM) {
00276                                                 output = argv->a_w.w_sym;
00277                                                 argc--;
00278                                                 argv++;
00279                                         }
00280                                         else
00281                                                 output = _sym_list;
00282                                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[i], output, argc , argv);
00283                                         overFlow = false;
00284                                         break;
00285                                 }
00286                         }
00287                 }
00288         }
00289         
00290         // If no exact matches, look for wildcards.
00291         for (i=0; i < x->num_args; i++) {       
00292 
00293                 if(wc = strstr(x->arguments[i]->s_name, "*")) {
00294                         // Does the argument have anything following the wildcard?
00295                         if(*(wc+1) == '\0') {
00296                                 // Now compare the argument up to the asterisk to the message
00297                                 if(strncmp(msg->s_name, x->arguments[i]->s_name, x->arglen[i] - 1) == 0) {
00298 
00299                                         // Increment string past everything that matches including the asterisk
00300                                         char *temp = msg->s_name + (x->arglen[i] - 1);
00301                                         // Check for a slash, an asterisk causes us to strip off everything up to the next slash
00302                                         char *outMsg = strstr(temp, "/");
00303                                         if(outMsg)
00304                                                 output_msg(x, outMsg, i, argc, argv);
00305                                         else {
00306                                                 // no slash, output everything following the message
00307                                                 output_msg(x, NULL, i, argc, argv);
00308                                         }
00309                                         return;
00310                                 } else {
00311                                         // We break here because if the strncmp() fails it means we have a wildcard following an 
00312                                         // OSC message i.e. /robot/* but the incoming message doesn't begin with /robot
00313                                         //break;
00314                                 }
00315                         } else {
00316                                 // There is no NULL char after asterisk
00317                                 c = msg->s_name;
00318                                 while(wc && *(wc) == '*') {
00319                                         wc++;
00320                                         c++;
00321                                 }
00322                                         
00323                                 c += strlen(c) - strlen(wc);
00324                                 if(strncmp(c, wc, strlen(c)) == 0) {
00325                                         output_msg(x, c, i, argc, argv);
00326                                         return;
00327                                 }
00328                         }
00329                 } 
00330         }
00331 
00332         // the message was never reckognised
00333         if(overFlow)
00334                 outlet_anything(x->outlet_overflow, msg, argc , argv);
00335 }
